question: Which of the following events is not correctly matched?
explanation:
• Liberation day of Goa took place on December 19, 1961. Goa was freed from the Portuguese dominion after an extended freedom movement and army operation.
• Jawaharlal Nehru was born on November 14, 1889, in Allahabad, India. In 1919, he joined the Indian National Congress. He died on May 27, 1964.
• The Indo-China War occurred in 1962. A disputed Himalayan border was the main pretext for war, but other issues played a role.
• The Indian general election of 1951–52, held from 25 October 1951 to 21 February 1952.It was the first election to the Lok Sabha since India became independent in August 1947.
